comment: There are only quizzes and midterm/final. There are no options for review for the tests other than reviewing past quizzes.

Literally the easiest class you can take. Every week there was a discussion and a quiz due. All the quiz questions were from the textbook but mostly Quizlet is your friend and Socratic also helps!! I know it says SOCI 2201 but I took SOCI 1101!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Get ready for A LOTTT of discussion posts, they're super easy but it's 1 every week which can be annoying. Also a quiz each week, which is good because there isn't a lot of material on just 1 quiz. QUIZLET WILL BE YOUR BEST FRIEND WHEN STUDYING!!! Gives plenty of time for all assignments. Discussions, quizzes, exams that's it. Take this easy class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Otto was great! Same things due every week (discussion, chapter quizzes) which are nice for online classes. As long as you do the work youll get a good grade. Keep up with due dates and write good discussion posts!
This class is very easy to pass. I barely used my textbook. Her quizzes arent on lockdown so theyre very easy to pass.

This class was the easiest class I took this semester. As long as you read the chapters you will do good on the quizzes. All her work is straight forward. There was a mid-term and final but overall this class is an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: best teacher ever. i found the textbook online for free but i didnt read it once. every week has an easy discussion with a quiz. the quizzes are extremely easy, 100s every time. my class was completely online, no lectures, can get work done in less than an hour for full week.
I take her for online sociology and the class is great. If you do your work you will make an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Otto had the course set up a specific way. Every week, there is a module due that consists of reading a textbook chapter, doing a discussion, and taking a quiz. The material is not all that easy but you learn to get used to it. I never had any problems so I cannot speak on her character since it was an online class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Class is made up of quizzes, discussions, exams, and essays. Essays are not to be bad and she is a harsh critic. The discussions are an EASY 100 but the quizzes are surely not. The book is boring and is made up of articles that are long and dry. Also, the exams are a tad difficult as well. She curved the grades up 3 points. Had an 87 and got an A.

Do all discussions and quizzes. Discussions are not long and grading criteria is clear. Quizzes are only 5 questions. Read and they are easy. Four short easy essays. Final and midterm multiple choice and study guide given. I missed an essay due date for a good reason, she let me send it to her in order to make the difference between a D and a C.

This class wasn't that bad. You do have to read the textbook, because she does gives reading quizzes. But she also gives writing assignments about your opinion on the topics. The tests were not that hard, and she does give you a study guide that outlines the test. She is a great professor that is approachable and funny. I would recommend her.
Professor Otto is great! She is the ideal professor. Her lectures are very informative, and her tests are not too difficult.
Teacher is down to earth and knowledgeable about material because she is getting a doctrine in the field

She is the best professor I've ever had.  She explains exactly what will be on tests and even gives you an option of what type of test you take.  If you read you will pass all the quizzes.  She is really funny and down to earth.  She is more than willing to help and wants to get to know her students.  She wants you to succeed!  Take her!
